thread.title: Terrifying video shows Harrison Ford flying his plane just FEET over a Boeing 737 with 116 people on board as he misses runway at US airport
thread.title_full: Terrifying video shows Harrison Ford flying his plane just FEET over a Boeing 737 with 116 people on board as he misses runway at US airport

title: Terrifying video shows Harrison Ford flying his plane just FEET over a Boeing 737 with 116 people on board as he misses runway at US airport
text:
Opinion DICING WITH DISASTER Terrifying video shows Harrison Ford flying his plane just FEET over a Boeing 737 with 116 people on board as he misses runway at US airport 
The CCTV clip appears to show Ford’s Husky aircraft narrowly passing over the top of the passenger plane By JENNY AWFORD 22nd February 2017, 7:37 am TERRIFYING footage has captured the moment Harrison Ford’s plane came dangerously close to crashing into a Boeing 737 carrying 116 people at a US airport. 
The CCTV clip appears to show Ford’s bright yellow Husky aircraft passing within a few feet of the passenger plane before the actor completely missed the runway. Harrison Ford mistakenly flies over an airliner at John Wayne airport AP 13 Footage has captured the moment Harrison Ford’s plane came dangerously close to crashing into a Boeing 737 
The near-miss happened while the 74-year-old Indiana Jones star was trying to land at John Wayne Airport in southern California last Monday . 
He appeared to mistakenly land on a taxiway instead of a runway after flying low over the airliner, which had just started taxiing. The CCTV clip appears to show Ford’s bright yellow Husky aircraft passing within a few feet of the passenger plane AP The near-miss happened while the 74-year-old Indiana Jones star was trying to land at John Wayne Airport in southern California AP He was filmed landing on a taxiway instead of a runway AP 13 The video then shows the same landing from the back 
F ord was supposed to have landed on a runway that runs parallel to the taxiway, according to reports. 
"Was that airliner meant to be underneath me?" Ford asks in previously released sound from the air traffic control tower. 
The video then shows the same landing from the back, giving more time to the approach of Ford's private plane. 
The American Airlines Flight 1456, with 110 passengers and six crew members on board, departed safely for Dallas a few minutes after the incident. Splash News Harrison Ford narrowly missed a passenger jet Fame Flynet The movie star was spotted inspecting his aircraft before take-off Splash News The Hollywood legend was flying his single engine plane Husky when he mistakenly aimed for the taxiway at John Wayne Airport rather than the runway Fame Flynet He was captured on air traffic control recordings asking 'was that airliner meant to be underneath me?' Harrison Ford is under investigation after mistakenly landing a plane in a taxiway Fame Flynet Harrison Ford hangs from the propeller of his aircraft at Santa Monica airport Fame Flynet Monday's near miss comes two years after he crashed his plane into a golf course, breaking his arm 
Ford is being investigated over the terrifying near-miss which could have resulted in a mid-air disaster. 
NBC reported that he violated Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) safety rules by landing on a taxiway. 
The FAA say the actor read the instructions back yet still somehow ended up aiming for the taxiway. The investigation could result in anything from a simple warning letter to a suspension of Ford’s pilot’s licence. related stories first look Fans get a glimpse of new Blade Runner as Harrison Ford goes back to the future to reprise role as Rick Deckard ‘SHE LIVED HER LIFE BRAVELY’ Carrie Fisher’s ex-lover Harrison Ford leads tributes to the Star Wars icon he 'had an intense affair with' RICK DECKARD IS BACK Ryan Gosling joins forces with Harrison Ford in epic Blade Runner 2049 trailer ALWAYS A PRINCESS Carrie Fisher auditions for iconic Princess Leia Star Wars role opposite Harrison Ford A LONG TIME AGO... Carrie Fisher 'surprised' at fan reaction over her affair with Star Wars co-star Harrison Ford DEATH SMASH ARREST Cops arrest man over horror crash which killed son of Frank Sidebottom creator Chris Sievey TRAVEL TROUBLES M5 crash causes long delays as two lanes shut on busy motorway 
Harrison has been involved in a series of crashes and near-misses while flying aircraft. 
In 2015, he crash-landed a World War II-era airplane on a Santa Monica golf course after the engine failed, suffering a broken arm and minor head injuries. 
But he was praised for keeping his cool after he managed to glide his airplane into the crash landing. 
Aviation expert Rick Dake said that Ford's landing was amazing considering the unforgiving nature of the World War II-era plane. AP:Associated Press A World War II-era trainer airplane rests on the ground after actor Harrison Ford crash-landed it in 2015 AP:Associated Press 13 Harrison Ford at the 73rd annual Golden Globe Awards in Beverly Hills, California earlier this year 
Rick told People : "Everything he did was perfect. He was able to keep that plane away from the houses and land it with the least impact on the community. 
"That was the best place he could have landed it. He was 100 per cent doing exactly what an excellent aviator would do." He also crash-landed a helicopter in 1999 during a flight lesson in Ventura County, California. 
And in 2000, Harrison’s six-seater Beechcraft Bonanza scraped the runway during an emergency landing at Nebraska’s Lincoln Municipal Airport. 
Ford’s love of the flying began in the 1960s when he took some flight training courses at Wild Rose Airport in Wisconsin. 
But at £12 an hour, he could not afford to continue the training. 
It was in the mid-1990s that Ford bought a used Gulfstream II and decided to ask a pilot to give him flying lessons. 
Since then, he has seldom been far from the pilot’s seat. 
Ford told the trade magazine Airport Journals in 2004: “I have more airplanes than it’s fair for anybody to have."
